Description: Lower body sherd and conical foot of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed (fired red) with trace of reserved dot at centre; exterior: bowl and top of foot reserved, glazed below (very worn); inscription on reserved underside.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros. The number in Petrie's catalogue, '48', is written in pen on the underside of the foot. The foot is heavier than typical squat chalices.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXII, no. 48)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1076) (phase 2)
